textline.text: Mark Cohen
Curriculum Vitae
mark.simon.cohen@gmail.com
http://sociology.fas.nyu.edu/object/soc.phd.markcohen
Ph.D. Candidate, Sociology, New York University
Expected completion: May 2016
Dissertation: “A Bridge of Rice and Silk, a Wall of Wheat and Rye: Reforming
States and Agrarian Change in Japan and Russia, 1853­1913”
Committee: Vivek Chibber (chair), Jeff Goodwin, Thomas Ertman
B.A., Philosophy, Columbia University
New York University
Department of Sociology
295 Lafayette St Fl. 4
New York, NY 10012
EDUCATION
2008 – present
PUBLICATIONS
“Historical Sociology’s Puzzle of the Missing Transitions: A Case Study of Early
Modern Japan.” ​American Sociological Review​ 80(3):603­25.
“The Political Process of the Revolutionary Samurai: A Comparative
Reconsideration of Japan’s Meiji Restoration.” ​Theory and Society​ 43(2):139­68
RESEARCH UNDER REVIEW AND IN PROGRESS
“Reforming States, Agricultural Transformation, and Economic Development in
Russia and Japan, 1853­1913,” under review for ​American Journal of Sociology
Southern United States before World War Two”
In progress With John Clegg, “The Logic of Safety­First Agriculture: Data from Japan and the
In progress Co­editor (with Suzy Lee and Jeremy Cohan) of book project currently collecting
submissions and preparing a proposal to submit to publishers
CONFERENCE PARTICIPATION
Paper, “Of Pyramids and Patchworks: The Social Origins of Capitalist
Development from Above,” American Sociological Association, August 22-25
Panel, “Rural Political Economy: Landed Elites, Rural Labor, and the State,”
Social Science History Association, November 6-9
Paper, “The Great Japanese Transformation: Submerged Commerce, Mercantilism
and the Transition to Capitalism,” American Sociological Association, August
Paper, “The Late Nineteenth Century As Critical Juncture: A Comparison of
Russia and Japan,” International Sociological Association, July 13-19
FELLOWSHIPS
2015 – 2016 Dean’s Dissertation Writing Fellowship, Graduate School of Arts and Sciences,
New York University
Japanese­Language Proficiency Test (JLPT) level N2
2008 – 2013 McCracken Fellowship, New York University
LANGUAGE CERTIFICATION
TEACHING
Teaching Assistant (selected)
2013­2015 NYU College Core Curriculum, Texts and Ideas: Antiquity and the Nineteenth
Century, Prof. Juan Corradi (2013­14) and Prof. Thomas Ertman (2015)
Introduction to Sociology, Prof. Harvey Molotch, NYU
American Capitalism in Theory and Practice, Prof. Vivek Chibber, NYU
Sociological Theory, Prof. Gabriel Abend, NYU
Research Methods, Prof. Kathleen Gerson (Spring) and Prof. Ann Morning (Fall),
NYU
ASSOCIATION MEMBERSHIP AND PROFESSIONAL SERVICE
2013 – present Member, American Sociological Association. Sections: Comparative/Historical
Sociology, Sociology of Development, Political Economy of the World System
2014 – present Member, Social Science History Association
Reviewer ​for American Sociological Review, American Journal of Sociology
REFERENCES
Vivek Chibber
Professor of Sociology, New York University
vivek.chibber@nyu.edu
Thomas Ertman
Associate Professor and Director of Undergraduate Studies, NYU Department of Sociology
Director, College Core Curriculum, NYU College of Arts and Sciences
thomas.ertman@nyu.edu

Professor of Sociology, New York University
